com.mapquest.android.maps
Class Overlay

java.lang.Object
  com.mapquest.android.maps.Overlay
Direct Known Subclasses:
CircleOverlay, DrawableOverlay, EllipseOverlay, ItemizedOverlay, LineOverlay, MyLocationOverlay, PolygonOverlay, RectangleOverlay, RotatableIconOverlay
public abstract class Overlay
extends java.lang.Object

Overlay is the base class used in drawing overlays on a map. You can create a custom overlay by sub-classing this or by using one of its direct subclasses provided in this SDK for basic functionality such as the LineOverlay, CircleOverlay, RotatableIconOverlay or DrawableOverlay. You can also provided the ability to snap to a point when users use pinch zooming by implementing the Overlay.Snappable interface.

Nested Class Summary
static interface Overlay.OverlayTapListener
          Listener used to notify on OverlayTapEvents, use this listener if you only care if an Overlay is tapped.
static interface Overlay.OverlayTouchEventListener
          Listener used to notify on OverlayTouchEvents, use this listener if you care about the actual coordinates where the Overlay was touched
static interface Overlay.OverlayTrackballEventListener
          Listener used to notify on Trackball events
static interface Overlay.Snappable
          When a touch event causes a zoom in and this interface is implemented in your overlay this onSnapToItem will be called to give the overlay a chance to reposition the point that is getting zoomed into.

draw

public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 MapView mapView,
                 boolean shadow)
Draw this overlay on the given mapView, by default this method does nothing. There should be two calls to this method, one for shadow of the marker the other for the marker itself

Parameters:
canvas - drawing canvas of the mapView
mapView - mapView where this request was started
shadow - draw the shadow or not on the current pass

draw

public boolean draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                    MapView mapView,

                    long when)
This method by default calls the draw(canvas, mapView, shadow) method with no delay

mapView -

this implementation always returns false

getKey

public java.lang.String getKey()
A key for this overlay, these should be unique but are not required nor enforced. You can use MapView.getOverlayByKey(String key) to retrieve this specific overlay

Returns:
defaults to an empty string if no key is provided with setKey
